thread.title: Thibaut Courtois gets trolled after inadvertently predicting Robbie Brady's stunning equaliser for Burnley
thread.title_full: Thibaut Courtois gets trolled after inadvertently predicting Robbie Brady's stunning equaliser for Burnley

author: Kit Mann
title: Thibaut Courtois gets trolled after inadvertently predicting Robbie Brady's stunning equaliser for Burnley
text:
Thibaut Courtois gets trolled after inadvertently predicting Robbie Brady's stunning equaliser for Burnley The real question, though, is if he predicted the free-kick...why wasn't he able to save it? Share Thibaut Courtois fails to save Robbie Brady's freekick - despite predicting it (Photo: Getty Images) Share Get Chelsea FC     
Well this is spooky. 
Robbie Brady fired in a superb free-kick equaliser against Chelsea on Sunday but the Blues' keeper had already predicted it. 
Sort of. 
Thibaut Courtois sent out a tweet last weekend saying "Brady on fire". Less than a week later and Brady sends a perfect free-kick past him . 
The Belgian was of course talking about Tom Brady during the Super Bowl where Brady's New England Patriots staged an impressive comeback to defeat the Atlanta Falcons. 
Massive NFL fan Courtois shot straight off to watch the game live in the States last weekend after his side had swept past Arsenal at Stamford Bridge. 
And little did he think that tweet about Brady would come back to bite him... ...but it did. Burnley's Robbie Brady score the equaliser (Photo: Reuters) Robbie Brady of Burnley scores his sides first goal (Photo: Getty Images) Burnley's Robbie Brady celebrates scoring the equaliser (Photo: Reuters) Burnley's Robbie Brady celebrates scoring their first goal (Photo: Reuters) 
Irish international Robbie sent the perfect free-kick past Courtois to level Pedro's opener at Turf Moor . 
Perhaps more amazingly it was the first free-kick Chelsea had conceded since 2013. 
And the Clarets hung on for an impressive point as their superb home form continues this season. 
Of course, Courtois's tweet did not go unnoticed online and some fans were quick to remind him of it. The real question, though, is if he predicted the free-kick...why wasn't he able to save it? poll loading Can Courtois predict the future? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
